results.title: French children: a farm family in Brittany
results.brief_description: Depicts a farm family living in Brittany. Emphasises family life, showing the work of each member and revealing customs and traditions. Includes scenes in a village school, an old castle and a neighbouring farm.
results.title_for_label: French children: a farm family in Brittany

results.title: French Canadians: the St Lawrence Lowland, Quebec
results.creator_credit: J.H. Lenauer and Louis de Rochemont Associates
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Earth and it’s peoples”.
Looks at life in the village of St Pierre in Quebec, depicting farming and dairying activities which have undergone little change for over three generations.

results.title: French-Canadian children
results.brief_description: A study of the home, school, and community life of a French-Canadian family, showing in particular the influence of the French heritage as it affects speech, manners, and customs.

results.title: Fremantle, first port in Australia
results.creator_credit: Fremantle Port Authority and Les Bambury
results.brief_description: Port facilities at Fremantle, Western Australia. The modern administrative buildings; the port inspection ship “Challenger”; two berth passenger terminal; cargo handling; rail and air terminals. Also some highlights of the port’s history.
results.description: Port facilities at Fremantle, Western Australia. The modern administrative buildings; the port inspection ship “Challenger”; two berth passenger terminal; cargo handling; rail and air terminals. Also some highlights of the port’s history.

results.title: Freeze-in
results.creator_credit: Albert Kish, ONF | NFB and F Whitman Trecartin
results.brief_description: A film essay without commentary about the port of Montreal as winter closes in - the last-minute scurry as ships that can make it dash for open water, while those that cannot prepare for a long hold-over. On the docks all activity seems suspended as the numbing cold closes its grip. But there is activity on the iced-in ships and in the freight sheds, making ready for the time when the icebreakers open a river channel and traffic returns. Film without words.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Albert Kish, ONF | NFB and F Whitman Trecartin

results.title: Freestyle and backstroke
results.brief_description: Part of the Competitive swimming series. Studies the underwater action of a team of Olympic swimmers. Demonstrates arm stroke technique, the twobeat kick and sixbeat flutter kick and breathing techniques. Excellent underwater photography. Variation between male and female swimmers.

results.title: Freestyle
results.creator_credit: Matt Morgan, AFTRS and David Lowe
results.brief_description: The police investigating the murder of a young male swimmer interview a woman who regularly swims in the pool where he was murdered. Did she really not see anything?

results.title: Freefall
results.creator_credit: David Stacey and Arts Council of Great Britain
results.brief_description: The choreographer and dancer, Gaby Agis, has a unique style, taking dance out of the confines of the theatre and into new spaces and contexts. For this film she has taken the dance to the city, essentially London. Gaby and her Company move through narrow streets and alleys, over rooftops, constant building sites and sudden, quiet green spaces, touching in a synthesis of choreography and place only possible through film.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Stacey and Arts Council of Great Britain

results.title: Freedom to read
results.creator_credit: Erik Barnouw, Center for Mass Communication of Columbia University and Julian Roffman
results.brief_description: A discussion film dealing with the problem of censorship as it affects the public library. Dramatized incidents are used in presenting opposing points of view and in raising questions regarding the role of the Library in a democratic country.
